title: Darius pull should not count as knockup.
body: After being flash engaged a couple time with a Darius + Yasuo combo on ARAM, I think it's pretty random that Darius pull counts as a knock up. So, why does it count as a knock up?

replies.body:
Yasuo's ultimate specifically says it can be activated on an **Airborne** target.

**Airborne** is a collection of status effects, all of them having to do with displacement. Knockup is Airborne, Knockback is Airborne, and Pull/Fling is Airborne.
any displacement works. including small things like Quinn's Vault.  That's just how the mechanic works, there's no issue with that imo.
Yasuo can ult on any Airborn targets. The pull makes you Airborn while pulling you to Darius.
Yes, but the pull doesn't really feel like a move that makes you airborne. Generally champions that are airborne are PHYSICALLY IN THE AIR.

Darius's pull is not the only cc that should not trigger yas's ult.

Honestly, if Riot would rework the coding, to where certain abilities (Thresh q, Vayne condem, Alistar W), Yas could actually recieve some buffs.

The amount of cc that triggers his ult is ridiculous.

If I remember correctly Syndra's E is something Yasuo can ult off of.

If it moves you, basically he can ult off of it.

Even if you're technically not airborne I believe.
Pretty much anything that makes your opponent move counts.  Including: Trundle pillar and Anivia wall.

any displacement is a knock up as far as i know, except blitz/naut/thresh pulls
you know that tiny window when quinn vaults you is a knock up?
hecarim charge is a knock up?
fuqing lee sin kicks... ?
